## Overview

Historical project. A JavaScript implementation of the 'three in a row' game, created in 2013, is notable for being the first game that was completed from start to finish. The code is a kind of spaghetti that somehow works. However, there are some enlightening moments. For example, I was surprised to discover that setTimeout can accept a string as its first argument, functioning like eval. I wasn't aware of this, although 10 years ago I did know â€“ let's call it 'lost ancient knowledge'
